channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Are you worried about your SNAP benefits? NPR wants to hear your story
item.description: As the federal government shutdown drags on, tens of millions of people are at risk of losing food and nutrition aid as a result. The NPR Network want...

item.title: How to decide whether to step back from a difficult relationship — or stick it out
item.description: When a loved one is behaving in a way that bothers you, should you lean into the relationship or take a break? If you're having trouble deciding, ther...

item.title: How Israel is winning the wars and losing the peace
item.description: Israel has strengthened its security with a series of sweeping military victories in the past two years. It has also become far more isolated internat...

item.title: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa brings flooding and catastrophic winds to Jamaica
item.description: The Caribbean storm — among the most powerful in history, with 185 mph winds — is expected to bring flash-flooding and landslides as it slowly moves a...

item.title: SNAP runs out of money Nov. 1. States are now figuring out how to feed millions of people
item.description: As November looms, states are trying to sort what options they can offer beneficiaries to fill the gap in food assistance. Reporters from the NPR Netw...

item.title: Texas attorney general sues Tylenol makers over autism claims
item.description: He accuses them of hiding alleged dangers from the drug, following the Trump administration's unproven claim it is linked to autism.

item.title: Pregnant British teenager's family pay £137,000 to reduce sentence in Georgia jail
item.description: The pregnant 19-year-old faces drugs charges in Georgia and is back in court on Monday.

item.title: Russian forces gain foothold in strategic Ukrainian town
item.description: Ukraine's president confirms Russian soldiers have taken up position inside the town of Pokrovsk.

item.title: Senate Democrats to force vote aimed at blocking Trump's tariffs on Brazil
item.description: The Senate is expected to vote Tuesday on a measure that would block President Trump's tariffs on Brazil, as Democrats seek support from a handful of ...

item.title: Senate fails to advance GOP bill to end shutdown for 13th time
item.description: The Senate failed for a 13th time on advancing a GOP funding bill that would end the government shutdown, now on Day 28. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Obesity rate is declining as more Americans use weight loss drugs, survey finds
item.description: As more Americans turn to weight loss drugs, the U.S. adult obesity rate​ is declining, according to new survey data from Gallup​.

item.title: Judge orders daily meetings with Border Patrol official Bovino on Chicago immigration crackdown
item.description: A federal judge has ordered a senior U.S. Border Patrol official to meet her daily “to hear about how the day went” after weeks of confrontations betw...

item.title: Jury deliberations start in trial of Illinois deputy who killed Sonya Massey
US kills 14 in strikes on four alleged drug boats in Pacific
item.description: Mexico's navy is searching for the sole survivor of the latest attack on boats the US says were carrying drugs in both the Pacific and Caribbean.

item.title: Gold's price plunges below $4,000. Here's how investors can take advantage.
item.description: Gold's price continued to decline this week. Here's how investors can take advantage of this timely opportunity.

item.title: Chicago’s children are getting caught in the chaos of immigration crackdowns
Melissa is one of the strongest hurricanes recorded in the Atlantic
item.description: Hurricane Melissa​, which struck Jamaica as a Category 5, is among the strongest hurricanes to have formed in the Atlantic since records were kept.

item.title: Brigitte Macron's life 'deteriorated' after alleged cyber-bullying, daughter says
item.description: Tiphaine Auzière was testifying in the trial of ten people accused of cyber-bullying her mother, the French first lady.
